bibl.title: In Re: Application of N. T. B. Pentreath for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington.
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western Disctrict of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

person.persName: J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States in the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: United States of America.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, Ninrth Judicial Circuit---WESTERN District of Washington.
Northern Division.
IN THE MATTER OF N. T. B. Pentreath On Habeas Corpus.
The President of the United States of America,
To Thomas Delaney, Chief of Police, Seattle, Washington.
Greeting:

You are Hereby Commanded, That you have the body of N. T. B. Pentreath by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name he shall be called or charged, before the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth Judicial Circuity, WESTERN District of Washignton, at the Court-room of said Court, in the City of Seattle on the 31st day of March, 1905, at ten o'clock A.M., to do and receive what shall then be considered in the premises. And have you then and there this Writ.

Witness, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, and teh seal of said Circuit Court, this 30th day of March, in the year of our Lord one thousand nineeight hundred and ninety five, end of our independence the 129th.
A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk.
By R. M. Hopkins, Deputy Clerk.
Ongoing.
Circuit Court of the United States, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, Northern Division.
IN THE MATTER OF N. T. B. Pentreath ON HABEAS CORPUS.
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RETURN THERETO.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court Wester Dist. of Washington.
A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk
H. M. Matthew, Deputy Clerk.
